intro: Fumaria diffusa, commonly known as the common fumitory, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the spring and early summer. Fumaria diffusa is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils such as roadsides and waste areas. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
